name: AzureContainerApps
description: An Azure DevOps Task to build and deploy Azure Container Apps.
author: Microsoft Corporation
releaseNotes: Released new AzureContainerApps task for building and deploying Azure Container Apps.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory where the script is run.  Empty is the root of the repo (build) or artifacts (release), which is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)

inputs.name: appSourcePath
inputs.label: Application source path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Absolute path on the runner of the source application code to be built. If not provided, the 'imageToDeploy' argument must be provided to ensure the Container App has an image to reference.

inputs.name: connectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Resource Manager connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Resource Manager service connection for the deployment

inputs.name: acrName
inputs.label: Azure Container Registry name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Azure Container Registry that the runnable application image will be pushed to.

inputs.name: acrUsername
inputs.label: Azure Container Registry username
inputs.helpMarkDown: The username used to authenticate push requests to the provided Azure Container Registry. If not provided, an access token will be generated via 'az acr login' and provided to 'docker login' to authenticate the requests.

inputs.name: acrPassword
inputs.label: Azure Container Registry password
inputs.helpMarkDown: The password used to authenticate push requests to the provided Azure Container Registry. If not provided, an access token will be generated via 'az acr login' and provided to 'docker login' to authenticate the requests.

inputs.name: dockerfilePath
inputs.label: Dockerfile path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path to the Dockerfile in the provided application source that should be used to build the image that is then pushed to ACR and deployed to the Container App. If not provided, this task will check if there is a file named 'Dockerfile' at the root of the provided application source and use that to build the image. Otherwise, the Oryx++ Builder will be used to create the image.

inputs.name: imageToBuild
inputs.label: Docker image to build
inputs.helpMarkDown: The custom name of the image that is to be built, pushed to ACR and deployed to the Container App by this task. Note: this image name should include the ACR server; e.g., <acr-name>.azurecr.io/<repo>:<tag>. If this argument is not provided, a default image name will be constructed in the form of <acr-name>.azurecr.io/ado-task/container-app:<build-id>.<build-number>.

inputs.name: imageToDeploy
inputs.label: Docker image to deploy
inputs.helpMarkDown: The custom name of the image that has already been pushed to ACR and will be deployed to the Container App by this task. Note: the image name should include the ACR server; e.g., <acr-name>.azurecr.io/<repo>:<tag>. If this argument is not provided, the value provided (or determined) for the 'imageToBuild' argument will be used.

inputs.name: containerAppName
inputs.label: Azure Container App name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Azure Container App that will be created or updated. If not provided, this value will be in the form of ado-task-app-<build-id>-<build-number>.

inputs.name: resourceGroup
inputs.label: Azure resource group name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The resource group that the Azure Container App will be created in. If not provided, this value will be in the form of <container-app-name>-rg.

inputs.name: containerAppEnvironment
inputs.label: Azure Container App environment
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Azure Container App environment to use with the application. If not provided, an existing environment in the resource group of the Container App will be used, otherwise, an environment will be created in the format of <container-app-name>-env.

inputs.name: runtimeStack
inputs.label: Application runtime stack
inputs.helpMarkDown: The platform version stack that the application runs in when deployed to the Azure Container App. This should be provided in the form of <platform>:<version>. If not provided, this value is determined by Oryx based on the contents of the provided application. Please view the following document for more information on the supported runtime stacks for Oryx: https://github.com/microsoft/Oryx/blob/main/doc/supportedRuntimeVersions.md

inputs.name: targetPort
inputs.label: Application target port
inputs.helpMarkDown: The designated port for the application to run on. If not provided, this value is 80 for Python applications, and 8080 for all other supposed platforms.

inputs.name: location
inputs.label: Location of the Container App
inputs.helpMarkDown: The location that the Container App (and other created resources) will be deployed to.

inputs.name: environmentVariables
inputs.label: Environment variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: A list of environment variable(s) for the container. Space-separated values in 'key=value' format. Empty string to clear existing values. Prefix value with 'secretref:' to reference a secret.

inputs.name: disableTelemetry
inputs.label: Disable telemetry
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set to 'true', no telemetry will be collected by this Azure DevOps Task. If set to 'false', or if this argument is not provided, telemetry will be sent to Microsoft about the Container App build and deploy scenario targeted by this Azure DevOps Task.
